Fantazima v koprski Čudolandiji
06 Nov 2019, 14:21 by Nataša Hlaj

Novo-staro ime prazničnega dogajanja v Kopru, ki se bo letos začelo 29. novembra ob 17. uri na Titovem trgu s tradicionalnim prižigom svetlobne okrasitve v mestu, je Fantazima v Čudolandiji. Novosti so še: eno, ampak večje drsališče ob morju, video projekcija z glasbeno spremljavo na pročelju Pretorske palače, osvetljena nogometna žoga se seli v Dekane, ognjemeta pa ne bo.



V Hlavatyjevem parku ob tržnici bodo tudi letos na ogled gigantske svetleče živali. Foto: Tomaž Primožič/FPA

KOPER > “Da, obdržali bomo Čudolandijo, le da bomo ime prostora vsebinsko dopolnili z bogatim programom, ki smo ga poimenovali Fantazima. Čudolandija je zaščiteno ime, ki se je zasidralo med ljudmi, zato se nam je zdelo prav, da ga obdržimo,” odločitev utemeljuje koprski župan Aleš Bržan.
Letošnji praznični program z osvetlitvijo bo občino stal približno 400.000 evrov, kar je trikrat manj kot lani, ko so v proračunu za ta namen zagotovili skoraj 1,2 milijona evrov. “Ognjemeta pa ne bo in tako bo, dokler bom jaz župan,” je jasen Bržan.
Popovič: “Saj niso imeli druge izbire”
“Toliko so tolkli po naši marketinški potezi, zdaj pa se ji niso odpovedali. Pa saj niso imeli druge izbire. Ime je bilo preveč popularno. Očitno so ugotovili, da je bila naša zamisel prava in dobra. Enako se je zgodilo z osvetlitvijo, za katero so opozarjali, kako je predraga. Veliko večino bodo ohranili in še dokupili so jo,” pravi njegov predhodnik Boris Popovič.
Kritiko namenja odločitvi občinskega vodstva, da bodo praznične lučke prižgali na dan, ko bo mesto pokalo po šivih zaradi nakupovalne mrzlice Črni petek. “Z logističnega in vseh drugih vidikov je povsem neprimerno združevati dva tako veliko dogodka,” ocenjuje. Po njegovem prepričanju pa ne gre le za zgrešen dan, temveč bi morali dogajanje zagnati že v začetku meseca. “Že tako je v tem času v mestu mrtvilo, zdaj pa bodo čakali še do 29. novembra. To je velika gospodarska škoda za gostince in trgovce,” je oster Popovič.
Novih 99.000 evrov za praznične lučke
V koprski občini napovedujejo, da bo mesto letos osvetljeno v podobnem obsegu kot lani, a vendar bolj smiselno in okusno. Lani najete barvne svetlobne elemente, ki so vzbujali največ ogorčenja, bodo nadomestili z novimi verigami, okraski in figurami v beli oziroma zlati barvi, s čimer nameravajo smiselno, predvsem pa vsebinsko zaokrožiti praznično razsvetljavo v mestu.
Prek javnega razpisa so izbrali podjetje MK Illumination iz Maribora, ki bo za 99.000 evrov dobavilo dodatne svetlobne elemente. Na očitek, da so kljub veliki vsoti denarja, ki jo je njegov predhodnik že porabil v ta namen, zopet trošili, pa Bržan odgovarja, da so morali nadomestiti najete okraske, “saj bi bilo čudno, če nekatere ulice ne bi bile okrašene”.
Letos brez nogometne žoge in pingvinov
Svetleče mreže bodo namestili le na Kidričevo in Čevljarsko ulico, medtem ko jih na Verdijevi ulici letos ne bo, saj so predvideli drugačno okrasitev. Svetleče elemente bodo pritrdili v že zavrtane luknje in na kavlje, za kar so v občini pridobili vsa soglasja. “Dijaki Srednje tehniške šole Koper bodo naredili konstrukcijo, ki bo osvetlila Kardeljevo ploščad, in komaj čakam videti, kakšna bo,” je navdušen župan Bržan.
Dobršen del luči bodo namestili na lanske lokacije, a z nekaterimi prilagoditvami. Obiskovalci med drugim ne bodo več mogli občudovati osvetljene nogometne žoge, ki se seli v Dekane, ob morju pa ne bo več pingvinov. V Hlavatyjevem parku ob tržnici bodo tudi letos na ogled gigantske svetleče živali, na Prešernov trg pa nameravajo namestiti velike svetleče krogle.
Prednost domačim glasbenikom
Za razliko od prejšnjih let bodo tokrat praznični program sooblikovali predvsem domači glasbeniki, sodelovalo pa bo tudi veliko domačih društev in drugih ustvarjalcev, med drugi sta pri tem moči združili tudi dve radijski postaji - Radio Koper in Radio Capris.
Tradicionalni prižig lučk bodo pospremila priznana primorska glasbena imena, kot so Lea Sirk, Anika Horvat, Iztok Novak Easy, Slavko Ivančić, Žiga Rustja, Klapa Semikantá in skupina Gedore. Preostali del programa bo tematsko obarvan. Tako bodo ob ponedeljkih nastopali pevski zbori in folklorna društva, ob torkih bodo na programu pihalni orkestri, srede bodo rezervirane za akustične večere, četrtke bodo namenili mladim glasbenikom, ob petkih bodo nastopali tribute bandi, ob sobotah obalni glasbeniki, nedelje pa bodo minile v znamenju klapskih večerov.
Največje drsališče v Sloveniji
Drsališče bo prav tako zaživelo 29. novembra in bo obratovalo vse do 5. januarja. Letos bodo postavili le enega, na lokaciji tik ob morju, stezo pa bodo podaljšali. “Z 850 kvadratnimi metri bo po trenutnih podatkih največje drsališče v državi. Poskrbljeno bo za zabavni program, denimo hokej tekme in šolo drsanja, občina pa bo osnovnošolcem znova omogočila brezplačno vodeno animacijo na ledu v dopoldanskem času,” pravi Vodja Turistične organizacije Koper Ylenia Loredan.V bližini bo pestra gostinska ponudba v kakšnih 12 hiškah in bogat vsakodnevni spremljevalni program, medtem ko se na Titovem trgu, kjer bo tudi božično-novoletna jelka, obeta novost, in sicer video projekcija, imenovana mapping.
“Gre za posebno vrsto projekcije na glasbeno podlago, ki je po svetu precej razširjena. Zaradi posebne grafične obdelave ima gledalec občutek, da se objekt premika, sesuva in spreminja obliko,” pojasnjuje Loredanova in dodaja, da bodo projekcije na programu vsak dan v večernem času.
Tudi letos dva praznična sejma
Tudi letos bodo pripravili dva praznična sejma: Miklavžev sejem (med 4. in 7. decembrom) in božično-novoletni sejem (med 23. in 29. decembrom), Miklavževanje za otroke z nastopi pevskih zborov koprskih osnovnih šol in prihodom Miklavža, ki bo 6. decembra. 30. decembra pa še Silvestrovanje za otroke z novoletno predstavo, prihodom dedka Mraza in glasbenim nastopom Andreje Župančič. Na zadnji letošnji dan, 31. decembra, bo Taverna gostila tradicionalno silvestrovanje S Koprom v novo leto 2020 s skupino Rock Partyzani.
Praznično dogajanje bo zavzelo tudi podeželje, še posebej pestro bo v Dekanih, Šmarjah, Marezigah, Sv. Antonu, na Škofijah in v drugih okoliških krajih, kjer pripravljajo številne aktivnosti in dogodke.


V Kopru bodo obdržali Čudolandijo, ki jo bodo nadgradili s Fantazimo, velikega svetlobnega napisa pa ne nameravajo ohraniti. Foto: Tomaž Primožič/FPA

Fantasies in the Kudolandia of Koper
06 Nov 2019, 14:21 by Natasa Hlaj

The new and old name of the festive event in Koper, which will begin this year on November 29th at 5pm in Tito Square with the traditional lighting of light decoration in the city, is Fantazima in Čudolandija. The news is: one but a larger ice skating rink by the sea, a video projection with music on the front of the Praetorian Palace, a lit soccer ball moves to the Deccan, and there will be no fireworks.



Hlavaty's Park next to the Market will also see a giant glowing animal this year. Photo: Tomaz Primozic / FPA

KOPER> “Yes, we will keep the Wonderland, but we will supplement the name of the space with a rich program called Fantazima. Cudolandija is a protected name anchored among people, so we felt it was right to keep it, ”the mayor of Koper, Ales Brzan, justifies the decision.
This year's holiday lighting program will cost the municipality about € 400,000, three times less than last year when it allocated almost € 1.2 million to the budget. "But there will be no fireworks, and so it will be as long as I am mayor," Brzhan is clear.
Popovich: “They had no other choice”
"They've been hitting so much on our marketing ploy, but now they haven't given up. But they had no choice. The name was too popular. They obviously realized that our idea was right and good. The same thing happened with the lighting, which they warned was too expensive. They will retain the vast majority and continue to buy it, ”says his predecessor, Boris Popovich.
Criticism lays on the decision by the municipal leadership to light the holiday lights on the day when the city bursts at the seams due to Black Friday shopping fever. "From a logistical and all other perspectives, it is totally inappropriate to combine two such great events," he estimates. According to him, it is not only a wrong day, but we should start the event early in the month. "It has already been dead in the city at this time, and now they will have to wait until November 29. This is a major economic disadvantage for caterers and merchants, ”said Popovich.
New € 99,000 for holiday lights
The municipality of Koper predicts that this year the city will be illuminated to a similar extent as last year, but more meaningful and tasty. Last year, the hired colored lighting elements that aroused the most outrage will be replaced with new chains, ornaments and figures in white and gold, respectively, aiming to make sense of the festive lighting in the city.
Through the tender, they selected MK Illumination from Maribor, which will supply additional lighting elements for € 99,000. He complains that, despite the large sum of money his predecessor has already spent on this purpose, they have spent again, Brzan replies that they had to replace the hired ornaments, "because it would be strange if some streets were not decorated".
No football and penguins this year
Lighting nets will only be installed at Kidričeva and Čevljarska Street, while there will be no such streets on Verdi Street since they envisaged a different decoration. The illuminating elements will be fixed in the holes already drilled and on the hooks, for which all the consent has been obtained in the municipality. “The students of Koper High School will make a construction that will illuminate the Kardelj's platform and I can not wait to see what it will be like,” is the enthusiastic Mayor of Brzan.
Most of the lights will be installed at last year's locations, but with some adjustments. Visitors will, among other things, no longer be able to admire the illuminated soccer ball moving to the Deccan, and there will be no more penguins by the sea. Hlavaty's park next to the market will also see giant glowing animals this year, and large glowing balls are planned to be installed in Prešeren Square.
Preference for native musicians
Unlike in previous years, this year's festive program will be co-designed mainly by local musicians, and will also involve many local societies and other creators, including, among other things, two radio stations - Radio Koper and Radio Capris.
The traditional lights will be accompanied by renowned coastal musical names such as Lea Sirk, Anika Horvat, Iztok Novak Easy, Slavko Ivančić, Žiga Rustja, Klapa Semikantá and the Gedore band. The rest of the program will be thematically colored. On Mondays, choirs and folklore societies will perform, wind bands will play on Tuesdays, acoustic evenings will be reserved on Thursdays, young musicians will attend, tribute bands will perform on Fridays, coastal musicians will attend on Saturdays, and Sundays will mark klapa evenings.
The largest skating rink in Slovenia
The rink will also be operational on November 29 and will run until January 5. Only one will be erected this year, near the seaside location, and the track will be extended. “At 850 square meters, according to current data, it will be the largest ice rink in the country. An entertaining program will be provided, such as a hockey game and ice skating school, and the municipality will again provide elementary students with free guided ice animation in the morning, ”says Koper Tourist Organization Director Ylenia Loredan. a companion program, while a new projection in the Tito Square, which will include a Christmas and New Year tree, is a video projection called mapping.
“This is a special type of projection on a musical basis, which is widespread worldwide. Due to the special graphic processing, the viewer has the feeling that the object is moving, collapsing and changing its shape, ”explains Loredanova, adding that the projections on the program will be daily in the evening.
Also two holiday fairs this year
Two festive fairs will also be organized this year: the Miklavž Fair (between 4 and 7 December) and the Christmas and New Year's Fair (between 23 and 29 December), Miklavževanje for children with performances by the choirs of the Koper elementary schools and the arrival of Miklavž. December 6th. On December 30, New Year's Eve for children with a New Year's performance, the arrival of Santa Claus and a musical performance by Andreja Župančič. On the last of this year, December 31, the Tavern will host the traditional New Year's Eve celebration of Koper with the Rock Partyzani group in 2020.
Festive events will also occupy the countryside, especially in the Decani, Smarje, Marezig, Sv. Anton, in the Dioceses and in other surrounding places, where they prepare numerous activities and events.


They will keep Kudolandia in Koper, which they will upgrade with Fantazima, but they do not intend to preserve the large light sign. Photo: Tomaz Primozic / FPA
